fields.content: * Note: some datasets are not available for your selected geography and were excluded from this analysis.
Welcome to the BLM Juniper Management Tool
A juniper management prioritization support tool for Eastern Oregon.

Ecotrust and the BLM have partnered to develop a conservation decision support system for Juniper management in Oregon.

This system will enable stakeholders to engage in strategic landscape-scale planning for Juniper management and sage grouse habitat conservation priorities for Oregon BLM lands.

Or, if you need to fine-tune the geography, you can use the map draw a box around additional watersheds. To navigate, use the keyboard controls (+/- to zoom, arrow keys to pan). If you need to undo the selection, click on the map away from the study region.
For each management objective, specify the acreage targeted for treatment.
For each management objective, the chart below shows the target acreage, and percentage, captured within the selected planning units.
In addition to the areas you targeted earlier, select areas that are to be avoided in the new prioritization scenario.

Please read the detailed documentation to gain a better understanding of the purpose, limitations and products associated with this tool. All users are able to design the map by selecting what data layers to show, explore the map using pan and zoom functionality, and investigate data sets pertaining to juniper as well as wildlife species, protected lands and management. Registered users sign in by clicking on the “sign in” menu in the upper right hand corner.

Build a Map

To begin exploring the Juniper Management Tool, click the “Select Data to Map” tab at the top of the map page. You will see six data themes that organize the spatial data into logical groupings. The Base Map heading layer at the top of the tree view will have different third-party base maps to choose from such as aerial imagery, topography or terrain. Under the Base Layers heading you can select data that will help orient you in the map, such as cities, highways and hydrology. The map will initially have the following layers selected as a base map for you: planning units, juniper utilization centers, roads, cities and basic terrain. To see a specific watershed name simply hover your mouse over the watershed. You can click on each watershed in the map for additional summarized information such the acreage of juniper phases, protected lands, sage grouse and pygmy rabbit habitat.

Explore Data Layers and Watershed Summarized Information

There are a number of data themes that organize pertinent data for juniper management, such as wildlife species and juniper phases. Other data sets available for viewing are data used to generate the priorities including species specific information and cost factors related to different treatment types and geographic variables. These data are under the heading “Summarized Data”. To explore these layers, click on the arrow next to the heading and a tree view will expand exposing the layers. Click on the check box next to the desired layer and you will see it appear on the map. Many of these data are imbedded in subsequent sub-folders. For additional information on any of these data layers, please see the data dictionary.

Create a New Juniper Management Prioritization Scenario

Add descriptive text here
Select the planning units that best define areas of your management interest.

There are currently no shared scenarios available.

Your colleagues can share their prioritization scenarios allowing you to view results and copy them to your own work space for further modification.

You haven't created any prioritization scenarios yet.

You can create customized prioritization scenarios, view the results on the map, study the output reports, export to various format, save them for future use, edit them and share them with colleagues.

Scenario should be rerun

New data has been loaded into the prioritization tool since this scenario was created. We recommended that you Edit and rerun the scenario to make sure the results are still valid with the current data.
